front: What are the three main forms of epithelial tissue based on location and function?
back: The three main forms of epithelial tissue are covering, glandular, and sensory.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What defines a surface epithelium?
back: A surface epithelium is defined by the number of cell layers, the morphology of the cells, and any surface specializations present.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe simple squamous epithelium.
back: Simple squamous epithelium consists of a single layer of flattened cells resting on the basement membrane. Viewed from the surface, cells are polygonal, and from the profile, nuclei project at the surface.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the two main locations where simple squamous epithelium is found, and what are they called?
back: Simple squamous epithelium is found lining body cavities as mesothelium and lining blood vessels as endothelium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe simple cuboidal epithelium.
back: Simple cuboidal epithelium consists of a single layer of cuboidal cells resting on the basement membrane. Cells have equal height and width, with rounded nuclei located in the center.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe simple columnar epithelium.
back: Simple columnar epithelium consists of a single row of columnar cells resting on the basement membrane. These cells often have a striated border at the apical pole and may include goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the three layers of stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium?
back: The three layers are the basal layer (cuboidal to columnar cells), the middle layer (polygonal cells), and the superficial layer (flattened, squamous cells with pyknotic nuclei).
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Where is stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium found?
back: It lines wet cavities such as the oral cavity, pharynx, esophagus, vagina, and anal canal.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe stratified squamous keratinized epithelium.
back: This epithelium has multiple cell layers, with the most superficial cells lacking nuclei and forming keratin filaments. It is found on the outer body surface (epidermis) and has a dry surface.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is the difference between the epidermis of thin and thick skin in relation to stratified squamous keratinized epithelium?
back: In thin skin, the epidermis is thinner and contains hair follicles, sweat glands, and sebaceous glands. In thick skin, the epidermis is thicker with a well-developed keratin layer, and only sweat glands are present.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium?
back: It appears stratified due to cells of varying heights and nuclei at different levels, but it's a single layer where all cells contact the basement membrane. It is characterized by ciliated cells, basal cells, and goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Where is pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium found, and what is it called in this location?
back: It is located in the airways and is known as the respiratory epithelium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe transitional epithelium (urothelium).
back: Transitional epithelium is a pseudostratified epithelium lining the urinary tract, composed of basal, intermediate, and superficial 'umbrella' cells. It is specialized to stretch and accommodate changes in bladder volume.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the three types of cells found in transitional epithelium?
back: The three types are basal cells (stem cells), intermediate cells (pear-shaped), and superficial 'umbrella' cells (dome-shaped).
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is a simple tubular gland, and where is it found?
back: A simple tubular gland, like the Lieberkühn gland in the small intestine, is a tube-like structure with a closed end that opens into the lumen of the intestine.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is a simple alveolar gland, and provide an example?
back: A simple alveolar gland has a single, short excretory duct and a branched secretory unit. An example is the sebaceous gland in the skin, which secretes sebum via a holocrine mechanism.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are compound tubulo-acinar glands?
back: These glands have branched secretory units (acini) that can be tubular, alveolar, or both, and they empty into a common excretory duct. Salivary glands are an example, containing serous, mucous, and mixed acini.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are cord type endocrine glands, and give an example?
back: Cord type glands have secretory cells arranged in rows or cords supported by reticular fibers, with capillaries running between the cords. The adrenal gland (zona fasciculata) is an example.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are follicle type endocrine glands, and give an example?
back: Follicle type glands consist of spherical follicles lined by follicular epithelium, enclosing a central cavity filled with colloid. The thyroid gland is a classic example.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the main components of connective tissue?
back: Connective tissues consist of cells, ground substance, and fibers.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe mucous tissue.
back: Mucous tissue is an embryonic connective tissue found in structures like Wharton's jelly in the umbilical cord. It is characterized by cells with cytoplasmic processes embedded in abundant ground substance.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe loose connective tissue.
back: Loose connective tissue has an equal proportion of cells, ground substance, and fibers. Collagen fibers form thin bundles with random orientation, creating areoles.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe dense irregular collagenous connective tissue.
back: This tissue is characterized by a predominance of fibers, specifically thick bundles of collagen with random orientation. The dermis of the skin is an example.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe dense regular collagenous connective tissue.
back: Dense regular collagenous connective tissue is characterized by a predominance of fibers, with thick collagen fibers arranged in parallel longitudinal bundles. Tenocytes are the flattened cells found here, often with 'gemini nuclei'.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is the function of the tenocytes in dense regular collagenous connective tissue?
back: Tenocytes are the flattened cells found in dense regular collagenous connective tissue (like tendons) that are reduced in number and help maintain the parallel collagen fiber structure.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe dense regular elastic connective tissue.
back: This tissue is characterized by a predominance of elastic fibers arranged in parallel. Examples include the nuchal ligament and the wall of the aorta.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is white, unilocular adipose tissue?
back: This is a specialized connective tissue where cells (adipocytes) are predominant. Each cell is large, containing a single, large lipid droplet that pushes the nucleus to the periphery, giving a 'signet ring' appearance.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe brown, multilocular adipose tissue.
back: Brown adipose tissue is specialized connective tissue where cells are small and polygonal, containing numerous lipid droplets and a central nucleus. These cells are organized in cords separated by capillaries and are involved in heat generation.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is the key difference in appearance between white and brown adipose tissue cells?
back: White adipose cells are unilocular with a single large lipid droplet pushing the nucleus to the side, while brown adipose cells are multilocular with numerous small lipid droplets and a central nucleus.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What is the characteristic appearance of hyaline cartilage in an H&E stain?
back: Hyaline cartilage exhibits a homogenous ground substance with a mosaic aspect: the territorial matrix is basophilic and the interterritorial matrix is eosinophilic. Chondrocytes are found in lacunae often forming isogenous groups and the tissue is covered by a perichondrium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: How are elastic fibers visualized in elastic cartilage using Weigert’s resorcin fuchsine stain?
back: In elastic cartilage stained with Weigert’s resorcin fuchsine elastic fibers appear purple and form a dense network surrounding the lacunae which may appear empty as chondrocytes are not stained.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe the appearance of decalcified spongy bone in an H&E stain.
back: Decalcified spongy bone in H&E stain shows a homogenous and eosinophilic organic matrix composed of type I collagen. Osteocytes reside in lacunae and osteoblasts are on the surface of trabeculae. Bone lamellae form trabeculae oriented by forces enclosing spaces filled with bone marrow.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the key features of decalcified compact bone in a longitudinal section (H&E stain)?
back: In longitudinal sections of decalcified compact bone (H&E) bone lamellae are concentrically arranged around Haversian canals which are interconnected by Volkmann’s canals. Osteocytes are in lacunae and the matrix is homogenous and eosinophilic.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: How do Haversian canals appear in a cross-section of decalcified compact bone stained with H&E?
back: In a cross-section of decalcified compact bone (H&E) Haversian canals are seen in cross-section and are surrounded by concentric lamellae containing osteocytes. The bone matrix is homogeneous and eosinophilic.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: "What is the characteristic architecture of ground compact bone in cross-section
back: and why do cavities appear black?" "Ground compact bone in cross-section reveals Haversian canals surrounded by concentric lamellae (osteons) and interstitial lamellae. Cavities and canals appear black due to trapped air as the section is unstained."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Identify the zones of ossification visible in the epiphyseal plate during endochondral ossification.
back: The epiphyseal plate in endochondral ossification shows distinct zones: 1. Zone of reserve cartilage  2. Zone of proliferation	 3. Zone of maturation	 hypertrophy	 and calcification	 4. Zone of erosion	 and 5. Zone of osteoid.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe the appearance of the 'calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes' in the zone of osteoid during endochondral ossification.
back: Calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes in the zone of osteoid exhibit a mixed appearance: the central cartilage matrix is basophilic while the peripheral osteoid is acidophilic.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the defining characteristics of striated skeletal muscle fibers in longitudinal section (H&E stain)?
back: Striated skeletal muscle fibers are long cylindrical possess numerous peripheral nuclei and exhibit a cross-striated appearance due to myofibrils giving the cytoplasm a deep acidophilic hue.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: How are nuclei and myofibril bands visualized in striated skeletal muscle using Iron Hematoxylin Heidenheim’s stain?
back: Iron Hematoxylin Heidenheim’s stain reveals the nuclei and the dark bands of myofibrils in black clearly demonstrating the striated pattern of skeletal muscle fibers.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: "How are skeletal muscle fibers organized within a skeletal muscle as an organ (cross-section
back: H&E stain)?" "In cross-section skeletal muscle fibers are polygonal with deep eosinophilic cytoplasm and peripheral nuclei. They are organized into bundles by the perimysium which are CT septa and the entire muscle is enclosed by epimysium and endomysium."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe the morphology of smooth muscle cells in both longitudinal and cross-sections (H&E stain).
back: Smooth muscle cells are elongated and spindle-shaped with a central nucleus in longitudinal view. In cross-section they appear round or oval and vary in size.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: "What are the distinguishing features of grey and white matter in a cross-section of the spinal cord
back: and where are large motor neurons found?" "In spinal cord cross-section the grey matter is centrally located and butterfly-shaped containing neuron perikaryons unmyelinated fibers glial cells and capillaries. The white matter is peripheral containing myelinated and unmyelinated nerve fibers. Large motor neurons are found in the anterior horns of the grey matter."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: "How is the myelin sheath visualized in peripheral nerve fibers using osmic acid stain
back: and what are nodes of Ranvier?" "Osmic acid stain stains the myelin sheath black in peripheral nerve fibers. The nodes of Ranvier are the gaps between segments of myelin along the nerve fiber."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: Describe the connective tissue sheaths surrounding nerve fibers and bundles in a nerve as an organ (H&E stain).
back: In a nerve as an organ (H&E) each nerve fiber is covered by endoneurium bundles of fibers are surrounded by perineurium and the entire nerve is enclosed by the epineurium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_EPITHELIAL_TISSUES

front: What are the two key factors used to define a surface epithelium?
back: The two key factors for defining a surface epithelium are the number of cell layers and the morphology of the cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Describe the characteristic appearance of simple squamous epithelium when viewed from the surface.
back: When viewed from the surface simple squamous epithelium cells appear polygonal with visible cell borders that stain darker appearing brown-black against a brown background.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the characteristic appearance of simple squamous epithelium when viewed in profile?
back: In profile simple squamous epithelium cells are flattened and their nuclei project slightly at the surface.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Describe the morphology of simple cuboidal epithelium as seen in profile.
back: In profile simple cuboidal epithelium consists of a single layer of cells that are equally tall and wide with rounded nuclei located in the center of the cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the defining characteristic of simple columnar epithelium?
back: Simple columnar epithelium is characterized by a single row of columnar cells resting on the basement membrane.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Where is stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium typically found?
back: Stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium lines cavities such as the oral cavity pharynx esophagus vagina and anal canal where the surface is always wet.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the key difference between stratified squamous keratinized and non-keratinized epithelium in their superficial cells?
back: In stratified squamous keratinized epithelium the most superficial cells lack nuclei and form keratin filaments while in non-keratinized epithelium the superficial cells retain their nuclei.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Where is stratified squamous keratinized epithelium found?
back: Stratified squamous keratinized epithelium is found on the outer surface of the body forming the epidermis of the skin and its surface is typically dry.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the defining feature of pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium that gives it a 'false' stratified appearance?
back: Pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium appears stratified because the cells are of different heights causing their nuclei to be located at different levels even though all cells are in contact with the basement membrane.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What types of cells are found in the respiratory epithelium (pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium)?
back: The respiratory epithelium is polymorphic and contains ciliated cells basal cells and goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the characteristic appearance of transitional epithelium (urothelium) when viewed in cross-section?
back: Transitional epithelium appears as a pseudostratified epithelium where all cells rest on the basement membrane  and it consists of basal	 intermediate	 and superficial 'umbrella' shaped cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What are the three types of cells found in transitional epithelium (urothelium)?
back: The three types of cells in transitional epithelium are basal cells (stem cells) intermediate cells (pear-shaped) and superficial 'umbrella' or dome-shaped cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: How are Lieberkühn glands (crypts) described in longitudinal section?
back: In longitudinal section Lieberkühn glands resemble a glove finger or a tube with a closed end facing the intestinal wall with the excretory duct opening into the intestinal lumen.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Describe the structure of a sebaceous gland.
back: A sebaceous gland has a single  short	 large excretory duct opening into a hair follicle	 and its secretory unit is large	 branched	 and composed of multiple lobules emptying into the same duct.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the mechanism of secretion for sebaceous glands?
back: Sebaceous glands utilize a holocrine mechanism of secretion where the entire secretory cell disintegrates to release its product.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What are the three types of acini found in compound tubulo-acinar glands like salivary glands?
back: The three types of acini in salivary glands are serous mucous and mixed acini distinguished by their secretory products.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: How are secretory cells arranged in cord type endocrine glands like the adrenal gland?
back: In cord type endocrine glands secretory cells are arranged in rows or cords supported by a network of reticular fibers with blood capillaries running between the cords.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: Describe the structure of the follicles in the thyroid gland.
back: Thyroid gland follicles are approximately spherical enclosing a central cavity filled with colloid and their walls are composed of follicular epithelium resting on a basement membrane.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: "What is mucous tissue
back: exemplified by Wharton's jelly primarily composed of?" "Mucous tissue like Wharton's jelly is an embryonic connective tissue consisting mainly of cells and ground substance with cells displaying cytoplasmic processes."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What characterizes loose connective tissue in terms of its components?
back: Loose connective tissue is characterized by an equal proportion of cells ground substance and fibers with collagen fibers forming thin bundles in a random orientation.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: How are collagen fibers arranged in dense irregular collagenous connective tissue?
back: In dense irregular collagenous connective tissue the collagen fibers form thick bundles with a random orientation.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the characteristic appearance of tenocytes in dense regular collagenous connective tissue?
back: Tenocytes in dense regular collagenous connective tissue are flattened cells with their nuclei often grouped in pairs referred to as 'gemini nuclei'.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What are the connective tissue components that organize a tendon as an organ?
back: A tendon as an organ is composed of the tendon itself and associated loose connective tissue organized into the epitenon peritenon and endotenon.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What type of fibers predominate in dense regular elastic connective tissue?
back: Dense regular elastic connective tissue is characterized by the predominance of elastic fibers which are arranged in parallel.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: How are elastic lamellae visualized in the tunica media of the aorta using orcein stain?
back: Elastic lamellae in the aorta's tunica media are stained brown by orcein stain appearing as wavy concentric parallel sheets.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: "Describe the appearance of white
back: unilocular adipose tissue cells in H&E stain." "White unilocular adipose cells appear polygonal or spherical with a 'signet ring' appearance: a rim of cytoplasm and a flattened peripheral nucleus with the central lipid droplet unstained."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: "What does Sudan III stain reveal in white
back: unilocular adipose tissue?" "Sudan III stain reveals the lipid droplets in white unilocular adipose tissue in an orange color."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: "How are cells organized in brown
back: multilocular adipose tissue?" "Cells in brown multilocular adipose tissue are organized in cords separated by capillaries and the cells are small and polygonal with numerous lipid droplets and a central nucleus."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_CONNECTIVE_TISSUES

front: What is the defining characteristic of surface epithelia?
back: Surface epithelia are always found at a free surface and are defined by the number of cell layers cell morphology and any surface specializations present.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the key features of simple squamous epithelium.
back: Simple squamous epithelium consists of a single layer of flattened cells resting on the basement membrane. When viewed from the surface the cells are polygonal with visible borders and in profile the nuclei project from the cell surface.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are the two examples of simple squamous epithelium mentioned
back: and where are they found?" "The two examples are mesothelium (lining body cavities) and endothelium (lining blood vessels)."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the key features of simple cuboidal epithelium.
back: Simple cuboidal epithelium consists of a single layer of cuboidal cells of equal height and width resting on the basement membrane. The nuclei are rounded and centrally located.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the key features of simple columnar epithelium.
back: Simple columnar epithelium consists of a single row of columnar cells resting on the basement membrane. In the small intestine this epithelium is polymorphic featuring enterocytes with a striated border and goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What are the three layers of stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium and where is it found?
back: The three layers are the basal (cuboidal/columnar)  middle (polygonal)	 and superficial (flattened	 squamous) layers. It lines wet cavities like the oral cavity	 pharynx	 esophagus	 vagina	 and anal canal.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What is the key difference between stratified squamous keratinized epithelium and non-keratinized epithelium?
back: Stratified squamous keratinized epithelium has a superficial layer where cells lack nuclei and form keratin filaments found on dry surfaces like the epidermis of the skin.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Where is stratified squamous keratinized epithelium found
back: and what are the differences between thin and thick skin?" "It forms the epidermis of the skin. Thin skin has a thinner epidermis and contains hair follicles	 sweat glands	 and sebaceous glands	 while thick skin has a very well-developed keratin layer and only sweat glands."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Explain the appearance and location of pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium.
back: Pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium consists of a single layer of columnar cells that  due to varying cell heights and nuclear positions	 appears stratified. All cells contact the basement membrane	 but only the tallest reach the surface. It is found in the airways and is known as the respiratory epithelium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What types of cells are found in the respiratory epithelium?
back: The respiratory epithelium (pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium) is polymorphic and contains ciliated cells basal cells and goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the structure and location of transitional epithelium (urothelium).
back: Transitional epithelium  also called urothelium	 is a pseudostratified epithelium lining the urinary tract. It consists of basal cells	 intermediate 'pear-shaped' cells	 and superficial 'umbrella' or dome-shaped cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What are the three types of cells found in transitional epithelium and their roles?
back: The three types are basal cells (stem/regenerating cells) intermediate cells (dilated apical pole narrow basal pole) and superficial umbrella cells (large dome-shaped apical pole).
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Describe the structure of a simple tubular gland
back: using the example of a Lieberkühn gland." "A simple tubular gland	 like a Lieberkühn gland in the small intestine	 resembles a tube or glove finger closed at one end (facing the intestinal wall) with its excretory duct opening into the intestinal lumen."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Describe the structure of a simple alveolar gland
back: using the example of a sebaceous gland." "A simple alveolar gland	 such as a sebaceous gland	 has a single	 short excretory duct opening into a hair follicle. The secretory unit is large	 branched	 and composed of multiple lobules emptying into the same duct. Secretion occurs via a holocrine mechanism."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are compound tubulo-acinar glands
back: and what are the three types of acini found in salivary glands?" "Compound tubulo-acinar glands have branched ducts and secretory units that can be tubular or acinar. In salivary glands the acini can be serous mucous or mixed."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Describe the structure of a cord type endocrine gland
back: using the adrenal gland as an example." "Cord type endocrine glands	 like the adrenal gland's zona fasciculata	 have secretory cells arranged in rows or cords supported by reticular fibers	 with blood capillaries running between the cords."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Describe the structure of a follicle type endocrine gland
back: using the thyroid gland as an example." "Follicle type endocrine glands	 such as the thyroid gland	 are characterized by spherical follicles lined by follicular epithelium. Each follicle encloses a central cavity filled with colloid and is surrounded by reticular fibers and capillaries."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What characterizes loose connective tissue?
back: Loose connective tissue has an equal proportion of cells ground substance and fibers. The collagen fibers are thin and randomly oriented forming areoles where cells and ground substance reside.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What characterizes dense irregular collagenous connective tissue
back: and where is it found?" "Dense irregular collagenous connective tissue is characterized by a predominance of fibers specifically thick bundles of collagen with random orientation. It is found in the dermis of thick skin."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the key features of dense regular collagenous connective tissue in a tendon.
back: Dense regular collagenous connective tissue in a tendon is characterized by a predominance of fibers with thick collagen type I fibers arranged in parallel longitudinal bundles. The cells called tenocytes are flattened and reduced in number often appearing in pairs ('gemini nuclei').
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What characterizes dense regular elastic connective tissue
back: and what stain is used to visualize it?" "Dense regular elastic connective tissue is characterized by a predominance of elastic fibers arranged in parallel. Weigert's stain or orcein stain can be used to visualize these fibers."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the appearance of elastic lamellae in the tunica media of the aorta using orcein stain.
back: Orcein stain reveals the elastic lamellae in the tunica media of the aorta as wavy  brown-colored structures arranged in concentric parallel sheets	 with unstained connective tissue and smooth muscle cells between them.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are the two types of adipose cells described
back: and what is a key characteristic of each?" "Unilocular adipose cells (1) and multilocular adipose cells (2) are described. Unilocular cells have a single large lipid droplet	 while multilocular cells have numerous smaller lipid droplets."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What is the general composition of hyaline cartilage
back: and what are the characteristics of its ground substance?" "Hyaline cartilage is a specialized connective tissue with a predominance of ground substance and numerous cells called chondrocytes. The ground substance is homogenous	 with a basophilic territorial matrix and an eosinophilic interterritorial matrix."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Where do chondrocytes rest in hyaline cartilage
back: and what are isogenous groups?" "Chondrocytes in hyaline cartilage rest in lacunae and can form isogenous groups	 which are clusters of chondrocytes derived from a single parent cell."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What stain is used to visualize elastic fibers in elastic cartilage
back: and what is their arrangement?" "Weigert’s resorcin fuchsine stain reveals elastic fibers in elastic cartilage. These fibers form a dense network surrounding the lacunae	 and elastic fibers parallel to the surface are found in the perichondrium."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What is removed from spongy bone in decalcified sections
back: and what is the appearance of the remaining organic component?" "In decalcified spongy bone	 the inorganic component of the matrix is removed. The remaining organic component is homogenous and eosinophilic due to type I collagen."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "Where are osteoblasts located in spongy bone
back: and how are the bone lamellae oriented?" "Osteoblasts in spongy bone are located on the surface of the trabeculae. The bone lamellae are grouped in trabeculae and oriented according to the forces acting on the bone."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "How are bone lamellae arranged in compact bone in longitudinal section
back: and what interconnects the Haversian canals?" "In longitudinal sections of compact bone	 bone lamellae are concentrically arranged around longitudinal Haversian canals. Oblique Volkmann’s canals interconnect the Haversian canals."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What is the relative proportion of medullary component and bone tissue in compact bone compared to spongy bone?
back: Compact bone has a reduced medullary component  with bone tissue being predominant	 whereas spongy bone has a predominant medullary component.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "In a cross-section of ground compact bone
back: what are osteons and interstitial lamellae?" "Osteons (or Haversian systems) are formed by concentric lamellae surrounding Haversian canals	 while interstitial lamellae are located between the osteons."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Why do cavities and canals appear black in ground compact bone mounted in Canada balsam?
back: Cavities and canals (Haversian and Volkmann’s canals  and lacunae) appear black in ground compact bone because they are filled with air	 which does not stain.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are the five zones of ossification in the epiphyseal plate
back: and what is the characteristic appearance of the calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes?" "The five zones are: reserve cartilage	 proliferation	 maturation/hypertrophy/calcification	 erosion	 and osteoid. Calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes appear as a combination of basophilic (central cartilage) and acidophilic (peripheral osteoid) material."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the key features of striated skeletal muscle fibers in longitudinal section.
back: Striated skeletal muscle fibers are long  cylindrical	 possess numerous peripheral nuclei	 and exhibit a cross-striated appearance due to myofibrils. The cytoplasm is deeply acidophilic.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What stain is used to visualize nuclei and myofibril bands in striated skeletal muscle
back: and what is seen in the endomysium?" "Iron Hematoxylin Heidenheim’s stain reveals nuclei and dark bands of myofibrils in black. The endomysium contains fibroblasts' nuclei and red blood cells in capillaries	 which also stain black."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are the connective tissue components of skeletal muscle as an organ
back: and how do they organize the muscle fibers?" "Skeletal muscle as an organ consists of epimysium	 perimysium	 and endomysium. The perimysium forms CT septa that divide the muscle into bundles of muscle cells."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the shape of smooth muscle cells in longitudinal and cross-section.
back: In longitudinal section  smooth muscle cells are elongated and spindle-shaped with a larger central part and tapered extremities. In cross-section	 they appear round or oval and vary in size.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "In a cross-section of the spinal cord
back: what are the relative positions and appearances of the grey and white matter?" "The grey matter is centrally located and butterfly-shaped	 appearing darker	 while the white matter is peripheral."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: What types of cells and fibers are found within the grey matter of the spinal cord?
back: The grey matter contains neuronal perikaryons  unmyelinated nerve fibers	 glial cells	 and capillaries. Motor neurons with dense neurofibrils can be seen in the anterior horns.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: "What are the three concentric sheaths of a myelinated peripheral nerve fiber
back: and how does osmic acid stain them?" "The three sheaths are the myelin sheath	 Schwann cell sheath	 and connective tissue sheath. Osmic acid stains the myelin black	 and the segments are separated by nodes of Ranvier."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: How are the connective tissue components of a nerve stained in a cross-section using osmic acid?
back: In a cross-section of myelinated peripheral nerve fibers stained with osmic acid  the myelin is black	 and the connective tissue (epi- and perineurium) is stained grey.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe the arrangement of connective tissue sheaths around nerve fiber bundles and individual nerve fibers in a whole nerve cross-section.
back: In a whole nerve cross-section  each bundle of nerve fibers is surrounded by perineurium. Inside the bundles	 each nerve fiber is covered by endoneurium	 and the entire nerve is enclosed by epineurium.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_MUSCLE_TISSUE

front: Describe simple squamous epithelium and where it is found.
back: Simple squamous epithelium consists of a single layer of flattened cells resting on the basement membrane; it is found lining blood vessels (endothelium) and body cavities (mesothelium).
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe simple cuboidal epithelium and its typical location.
back: Simple cuboidal epithelium is composed of a single layer of cuboidal cells with round  centrally located nuclei	 and is found in the excretory ducts of glands like the salivary glands.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe simple columnar epithelium and its key cell types.
back: Simple columnar epithelium consists of a single row of tall  column-shaped cells on the basement membrane	 often featuring enterocytes with a striated border and goblet cells	 as seen in the intestinal villi.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: How does stratified squamous keratinized epithelium differ from non-keratinized?
back: In stratified squamous keratinized epithelium the most superficial cells lack nuclei and form keratin filaments providing a protective dry surface.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What gives pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium its stratified appearance?
back: Pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium appears stratified because the cells are of different heights  causing their nuclei to lie at different levels	 even though all cells contact the basement membrane.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the cell types found in the respiratory epithelium (pseudostratified columnar ciliated epithelium)?
back: The respiratory epithelium is polymorphic and contains ciliated cells basal cells and goblet cells.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe the three cell types found in transitional epithelium (urothelium).
back: Transitional epithelium consists of basal stem cells  intermediate "pear-shaped" cells	 and superficial "umbrella" or dome-shaped cells that can distend.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What is the characteristic shape of Lieberkühn glands (crypts) in the small intestine?
back: Lieberkühn glands or crypts are simple tubular glands that resemble glove fingers or tubes with a closed end facing the intestinal wall.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the three types of acini found in compound glands like salivary glands?
back: Compound glands can contain serous mucous and mixed acini which differ in the composition of their secreted products.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "How are secretory cells arranged in a cord type endocrine gland
back: like the adrenal gland's zona fasciculata?" "In cord type endocrine glands secretory cells are arranged in rows or cords supported by reticular fibers with blood capillaries running between the cords."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Characterize loose connective tissue.
back: Loose connective tissue has an equal proportion of cells ground substance and fibers with thin collagen fiber bundles arranged randomly.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What is the predominant feature of dense irregular collagenous connective tissue?
back: Dense irregular collagenous connective tissue is characterized by the predominance of fibers with thick collagen fiber bundles arranged in a random orientation as seen in the dermis.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe dense regular collagenous connective tissue and the appearance of its cells.
back: Dense regular collagenous connective tissue has thick parallel collagen fibers and its cells called tenocytes are flattened with nuclei often grouped in pairs ('gemini nuclei').
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What is the key characteristic of dense regular elastic connective tissue?
back: Dense regular elastic connective tissue is characterized by the predominance of elastic fibers arranged in parallel as seen in the nuchal ligament and the aorta's tunica media.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: How are elastic fibers visualized in dense regular elastic connective tissue of the aorta?
back: Elastic fibers in the aorta's tunica media form wavy concentric elastic lamellae that stain brown with stains like orcein.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "How does Sudan III stain differentiate components in white
back: unilocular adipose tissue?" "Sudan III stain colors the lipid droplets orange while hematoxylin stains the nuclei allowing visualization of the cell structure and lobular organization."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "What are the distinguishing features of brown
back: multilocular adipose tissue?" "Brown multilocular adipose tissue cells are smaller polygonal contain numerous lipid droplets and have a centrally placed nucleus organized in cords separated by capillaries."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the two types of adipose cells described and what is their characteristic appearance?
back: Multilocular adipose cells have numerous lipid droplets and a centrally placed nucleus  while unilocular adipose cells are characterized by a single large lipid droplet that pushes the nucleus to the periphery.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe the ground substance of hyaline cartilage and its appearance with an H&E stain.
back: The ground substance of hyaline cartilage is homogenous and appears mosaic-like  with a basophilic territorial matrix and an eosinophilic interterritorial matrix.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "What is the appearance of decalcified spongy bone on an H&E stain
back: and what is the predominant component?" "Decalcified spongy bone appears homogenous and eosinophilic due to type I collagen	 with osteocytes in lacunae and osteoblasts on the trabeculae surface. The medullary component is predominant."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: How are bone lamellae arranged in decalcified compact bone (longitudinal section)?
back: In decalcified compact bone (longitudinal section)  bone lamellae are arranged concentrically around Haversian canals and interconnected by Volkmann's canals.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What is the relative proportion of medullary and bone tissue in compact bone compared to spongy bone?
back: Compact bone has a reduced medullary component and predominant bone tissue  whereas spongy bone has a predominant medullary component.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What is the characteristic appearance of osteons (Haversian systems) in ground compact bone?
back: In ground compact bone  osteons (Haversian systems) are characterized by concentric lamellae surrounding Haversian canals.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "How are lacunae and canals visualized in ground compact bone
back: and why?" "In ground compact bone	 lacunae and canals appear black because they are filled with air	 making the otherwise unstained structures visible."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the five zones of ossification found in the epiphyseal plate?
back: The five zones of ossification in the epiphyseal plate are: 1. Zone of reserve cartilage  2. Zone of proliferation	 3. Zone of maturation	 hypertrophy and calcification	 4. Zone of erosion	 and 5. Zone of osteoid.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe the appearance of the calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes in the zone of osteoid.
back: Calcified cartilage-osteoid complexes in the zone of osteoid have a combined basophilic (central cartilage matrix) and acidophilic (peripheral osteoid) appearance.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the key characteristics of striated skeletal muscle fibers in longitudinal section?
back: Striated skeletal muscle fibers are long  cylindrical	 possess numerous peripheral nuclei	 and exhibit a cross-striated appearance due to myofibrils	 with a deep acidophilic cytoplasm.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What structures are stained black by Iron Hematoxylin Heidenheim’s stain in striated skeletal muscle?
back: Iron Hematoxylin Heidenheim’s stain stains the nuclei and the dark bands of myofibrils black in striated skeletal muscle.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: How are skeletal muscle fibers and connective tissue components organized in a cross-section of skeletal muscle as an organ?
back: In cross-section  skeletal muscle fibers are polygonal with eosinophilic cytoplasm and peripheral nuclei	 while the connective tissue (epi-	 peri-	 and endomysium) is paler eosinophilic	 with perimysium dividing the muscle into bundles.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: Describe the shape of smooth muscle cells in longitudinal and cross-sections.
back: Smooth muscle cells are elongated and spindle-shaped with a central nucleus in longitudinal section  and appear round or oval in cross-section.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the characteristic features of grey and white matter in a cross-section of the spinal cord?
back: In a spinal cord cross-section  the grey matter is centrally located	 butterfly-shaped	 and darker	 containing neuron perikaryons and unmyelinated fibers	 while the white matter is peripheral and contains myelinated and unmyelinated nerve fibers.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "What stain is used to visualize myelinated peripheral nerve fibers
back: and what color does it impart to the myelin?" "Osmic acid stain is used to visualize myelinated peripheral nerve fibers	 staining the myelin sheath black."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: What are the three concentric sheaths that make up a myelinated nerve fiber?
back: The three concentric sheaths of a myelinated nerve fiber are the myelin sheath  the Schwann cell sheath	 and the connective tissue sheath.
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: "How are the different connective tissue layers (epineurium
back: perineurium  endoneurium) organized around nerve fibers in a nerve as an organ?"	"In a nerve as an organ	 the entire nerve is covered by epineurium	 bundles of nerve fibers are surrounded by perineurium	 and individual nerve fibers within bundles are covered by endoneurium."
deck: Anki-AI: Dm Revision 1St Sem 2023-2024 Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed::Dm_Revision_1St_Sem_2023-2024_Compressed_-_NERVOUS_TISSUE

front: From which embryonic germ layer does the entire central nervous system (CNS) originate?
back: The CNS develops from the ectoderm following the process of neurulation.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What is the primary origin of the peripheral nervous system (PNS) structures, including dorsal root ganglia and Schwann cells?
back: The PNS is derived primarily from the neural crest cells, which migrate from the dorsal neural tube.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What are the three primary brain vesicles formed early during the development of the neural tube?
back: The three primary vesicles are the prosencephalon (forebrain), mesencephalon (midbrain), and rhombencephalon (hindbrain).
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: Which layer of the developing spinal cord wall eventually becomes the white matter?
back: The marginal layer becomes the white matter as axons from neuroblasts grow into it.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What is the primary functional distinction between the alar plates and basal plates in the developing spinal cord?
back: The alar plates are sensory (afferent), while the basal plates are motor (efferent).
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: From which specific part of the rhombencephalon does the cerebellum arise?
back: The cerebellum develops from the dorsal rhombic lips of the metencephalon.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: Which structure of the adult brain is derived from the roof plate of the diencephalon?
back: The pineal gland (epiphysis) is derived from the roof plate of the diencephalon.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: Which part of the adult pituitary gland forms as an evagination of the diencephalon?
back: The neurohypophysis (posterior pituitary) forms from the evagination of the diencephalon known as the infundibulum.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What is the primary function of the corpus callosum during cerebral hemisphere development?
back: It serves as a major commissural pathway connecting the left and right cerebral hemispheres.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What is the primary cause of congenital hydrocephalus in the context of neural development?
back: It is usually caused by an obstruction of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) flow, often due to stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What characterizes an Arnold-Chiari malformation type II regarding the brainstem and cerebellum?
back: It is characterized by the herniation of the cerebellar tonsils and medulla through the foramen magnum.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::NERVOUS SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT

front: What are the three layers of the meninges, listed from outermost to innermost?
back: The three layers are the dura mater, arachnoid mater, and pia mater.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What are the two primary infoldings of the dura mater that compartmentalize the brain?
back: The falx cerebri, separating the cerebral hemispheres, and the tentorium cerebelli, separating the cerebrum from the cerebellum.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: Where is the majority of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) produced?
back: CSF is primarily secreted by the choroid plexus located within the ventricles of the brain.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: Through what structures does CSF drain from the subarachnoid space into the venous circulation?
back: CSF drains into the dural venous sinuses via arachnoid granulations.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What is the primary function of the meningeal lymphatic vessels?
back: They facilitate the drainage of interstitial fluid and immune cells from the central nervous system to deep cervical lymph nodes.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: Where are the meningeal lymphatic vessels anatomically located?
back: They are located within the dura mater, typically running alongside the dural venous sinuses.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What is the primary mechanism of waste clearance in the glymphatic system?
back: Convective flow driven by arterial pulsation that moves interstitial fluid through perivascular spaces.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: When is the glymphatic system most active?
back: The system is predominantly active during sleep, facilitating the clearance of metabolic byproducts like amyloid-beta.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What is the main cause of communicating hydrocephalus?
back: It is caused by an impairment of CSF absorption, often due to a malfunction in the arachnoid granulations or venous sinuses.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What defines meningitis as a pathology?
back: Meningitis is the inflammation of the meninges, specifically the pia and arachnoid mater, usually due to infection.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What specific space is filled with blood in a subdural hematoma?
back: The subdural space, a potential space between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What distinguishes the epidural space from the subdural space?
back: The epidural space is a real space between the skull and dura, while the subdural space is a potential space between the dura and arachnoid.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBRO-SPINAL MENINGES

front: What is a fasciculus in the context of nervous system anatomy?
back: A fasciculus is a group of nerve fibres that share the same origin, pathway, destination, and function, connecting two nervous structures.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: How is a neural pathway defined?
back: A neural pathway is a sequence of fasciculi that connects specific structures, such as receptors to the cortex or motor centers to effectors.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What connection is established by ascending neural pathways?
back: Ascending pathways connect peripheral receptors to the cerebral cortex.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What connection is established by descending neural pathways?
back: Descending pathways connect upper motor centres (from the cortex or subcortical structures) to peripheral effectors.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: Characterize the connection made by neural circuits.
back: Neural circuits connect one part of the central nervous system to another part of the central nervous system.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: Where is the sensory ganglion located and what cell type does it contain?
back: Located on the posterior root of spinal nerves or cranial nerve sensory fibres, it contains the body of the pseudounipolar neuron.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What is the primary function of a vegetative ganglion?
back: It is the site where a preganglionic neuron synapses with a postganglionic neuron to innervate the effector organ.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: Into which two categories are vegetative ganglia classified?
back: Vegetative ganglia are classified as sympathetic and parasympathetic ganglia.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What is the primary structural composition of white matter?
back: White matter consists largely of myelinated nerve fibres.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What is the primary structural composition of gray matter?
back: Gray matter contains nerve-cell bodies and unmyelinated nerve fibres.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What does the term 'tegmentum' refer to anatomically?
back: The tegmentum refers to the general area within the brainstem that serves as a covering.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::SPINAL CORD

front: What does the acronym ARAS stand for?
back: ARAS stands for the Ascending Reticular Activating System.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What does the acronym DIRS stand for?
back: DIRS stands for the Descending Inhibitory Reticular System.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What does the acronym DFRS stand for?
back: DFRS stands for the Descending Facilitatory Reticular System.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is the definition of a dermatome?
back: A dermatome is an area of skin that is mainly supplied by a single spinal nerve.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is a neuromere in the context of embryonic development?
back: A neuromere is a transient segment during the development of the neural tube, also known as an encephalomere or neural segment.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is a neuromere at the level of the spinal cord?
back: In the spinal cord, a neuromere is a metameric segment located at the origin of a pair of spinal nerves, also known as a medullary segment.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is the "real origin" of a neural fiber?
back: The real origin is the location of the neuron's cell body (soma).
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is the "apparent origin" of a neural fiber?
back: The apparent origin is the specific point where the fiber emerges from the surface of the Central Nervous System.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What are the two main parts of the encephalon?
back: The encephalon consists of the cerebral hemispheres and the diencephalon.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::BRAINSTEM

front: What is the main difference between the Somatic and Vegetative nervous systems regarding effectors and consciousness?
back: The Somatic system controls external relations via striated muscles and is conscious, while the Vegetative system controls internal organs via smooth/cardiac muscle and glands and is unconscious.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What are the primary structural components of a neuron?
back: A neuron consists of the cell body (perikaryon) containing the nucleus and organelles, dendrites that receive information, and an axon that conducts electrical impulses away.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: Where are pseudounipolar neurons typically found and what is their unique structure?
back: They are found in the spinal ganglia and have a single extension that divides into a T-shape, functioning as sensory neurons.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: How do Golgi Type I and Type II neurons differ in terms of axon length and function?
back: Golgi I are projection neurons with long axons forming tracts, whereas Golgi II are intrinsic interneurons with short axons that are usually inhibitory.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: Which glial cells are responsible for myelination in the Central Nervous System (CNS) versus the Peripheral Nervous System (PNS)?
back: In the CNS, oligodendrocytes provide myelination (up to 50 fibers), while in the PNS, Schwann cells secrete the myelin sheath.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What are the characteristics of C-type nerve fibers regarding myelination and function?
back: C-type fibers are unmyelinated with slow conduction (< 2 m/sec), acting as postganglionic vegetative fibers or pain/heat sensory fibers.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What is the primary function of astrocytes in the central nervous system?
back: Astrocytes provide physical support, help form the blood-brain barrier, and regulate nutrients and oxygen for neurons.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What role do microglial cells play in the central nervous system?
back: They act as macrophages to mediate immune responses, clearing cellular debris and dead neurons through phagocytosis.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What is the structural and functional difference between chemical and electrical synapses?
back: Chemical synapses use neurotransmitters across a synaptic cleft for unidirectional transmission, while electrical synapses use gap junctions for very fast, bidirectional transmission.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: How do Type 1 (asymmetric) and Type 2 (symmetric) synapses differ structurally and functionally?
back: Type 1 have a thicker postsynaptic membrane and are typically excitatory, while Type 2 have equal membrane thickness and are typically inhibitory.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What are the five components of a reflex arc in order?
back: The reflex arc consists of a receptor, sensory neuron (afferent), integration center, motor neuron (efferent), and effector.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What distinguishes a conditioned reflex from an unconditioned reflex?
back: Unconditioned reflexes are innate and genetically programmed, whereas conditioned reflexes are learned through temporary associations involving the cerebral cortex.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What does the term "tactile acuity" (two-point discrimination) measure?
back: It measures the ability to distinguish two separate points of contact simultaneously, which is highest in the fingertips and lips due to high receptor density.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: How many neurons typically constitute a general sensory (ascending) pathway compared to a voluntary motor (descending) pathway?
back: Sensory pathways typically involve three neurons (protoneuron, deutoneuron, tritoneuron), while voluntary motor pathways involve two neurons (central motor neuron and second neuron).
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What are the three sheaths covering myelinated axons in the Peripheral Nervous System?
back: The three sheaths are the myelin sheath (electrical isolator), Schwann’s sheath (secretes myelin), and Henle’s sheath or endoneurium (connective tissue).
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What characterizes Multiple Sclerosis as a disease process?
back: It is a neurodegenerative condition marked by focal demyelination and axonal degeneration, causing loss of impulse transmission.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM

front: What are the common clinical symptoms of Multiple Sclerosis?
back: Symptoms include double vision, vision loss, balance disorders, ataxia, sensory disturbances, and urinary retention.
deck: Anki-AI Crivii Neuroanatomy Umf Book::CEREBELLUM
